item.title: The oldest group of dancers among the women are those who are married, called old virgins, wearing black skirts.; including "Against the Swirl of Time"

scope_and_contents.item: Typed correspondence between Pederson and filmmaker Ray Phoenix concerns her obtaining his films of native life (Shembe, Abakhwetha, witch doctors), firewalking, and Egypt (from his trip to East Africa in 1950), and requests for him to obtain lion or other animal films for her. Two untitled, uncredited narration scripts apparently by Phoenix (for the Abakwetha and firewalking films; annotated by Pederson). Phoenix mentions his original script for a Shembe film (this may be the narration entitled "Against the swirl of time", original title "The place of spiritual uplift"). Receipts for films and records. Phoenix' plan to go to Kruger Park to photograph the Dhomba or Python girls' initiation dance; and his hope to tour the United States. Related correspondence between Pederson and African Car Hire regarding a misplaced tripod.

collection.description: Artifacts and other objects collected during Lydia Pederson's 1953 trip from Capetown, South Africa to Cairo, Egypt, and during Sonjia and Jim Olstad's 1967 stay in Nigeria: primarily beadwork, sculpture, carved calabashes, jewelry, and textiles. item.title: Correspondence between Ray Phoenix and Lydia Pederson; including invoices

scope_and_contents.item: Typed correspondence between Pederson and filmmaker Ray Phoenix concerns her obtaining his films of native life (Shembe, Abakhwetha, witch doctors), firewalking, and Egypt (from his trip to East Africa in 1950), and requests for him to obtain lion or other animal films for her. Two untitled, uncredited narration scripts apparently by Phoenix (for the Abakwetha and firewalking films; annotated by Pederson). Phoenix mentions his original script for a Shembe film (this may be the narration entitled "Against the swirl of time", original title "The place of spiritual uplift"). Receipts for films and records. Phoenix' plan to go to Kruger Park to photograph the Dhomba or Python girls' initiation dance; and his hope to tour the United States. Related correspondence between Pederson and African Car Hire regarding a misplaced tripod.

project.name: Afri Films Reel to Reel

ingest_project.title: P00382-P0094-Pederson-Films

description.item: Film reel containers are annotated: Native dancing & customs in South Africa (16 mm, Kodachrome, 1350 feet). -- Pretoria - Animals - Misc Zulus -- Misc dances - Pondos - misc. film with & without sound stripe -- Good Zulu dance -- Extra fire walking. -- Shembe, mass marriage. -- Black & white : Animals, various customs.

abstract.item: "Every year Mrs. Lydia L. Pederson spends her vacation seeing as much as possible of the world as quickly as possible. She is a partner in a large metal foundry in Rockford, Illinois and recently spent two days in Cape Town. At present Mrs. Pederson is on a vacation tour of two months which will take her through South Africa to the Victoria Falls, Tanganyika, Kenya, Egypt and Palestine and which will cost her $10,000. She travels only by air and by car. 'I am in too great a hurry and too restless to travel any other way - my vacation is too short, and there is yet so much more that I wish to see.' This is how she expressed herself last evening to the Burger, after having completed a whole day tour of Cape Town and the vicinity. She spends at the most a few days in a country, and the twenty days which she is spending in South Africa will be the longest that she has ever devoted to touring in one country. She has been travelling since 1925."--From included typescript, "Her dress will reflect a typical African atmosphere", translation of article in Afrikaans.

item.label: Pretoria - Animals - Misc Zulus - Mine Dances - Rondos
